net.refractions.skeletons

Class GeometryUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.refractions.skeletons.GeometryUtil

  • public class GeometryUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    dblasby This is general geometry functions that do manipulations of geometries. They were put here to make the keletonizer class simpler. translate(,x,y) -- translate the geometry write_shape(fname, <...>) -- write out a simple shapefile (for debugging)

      • simpleDensify

        public static Polygon simpleDensify(Polygon inPoly,
                                    double longestEdge)
        finds any edge with length> longestEdge and cuts the edge up. end result is a polygon with every vertex->vertex distance less than longestEdge
        Parameters:
        inPoly -
        longestEdge -
        Returns:
        re-constructed polygon. Has same coordinates as original, plus a few new ones.

      • clipSharpCorners

        public static java.lang.Object[] clipSharpCorners(Polygon p,
                                                  com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate[] riverInOutPoints,
                                                  double criticalCutAngle)
        This returns a new Polygon with the following properties: a. exterior ring is CW b. all holes are CCW c. sharp angles at the input coordinates have been clipped It also returns an ArrayList of 2 point SkelLineStrings. These will need to be added into the resulting skeleton. They connect the old river entry point to the new location after the polygon has the corner clipped.
        Parameters:
        p -
        riverInOutPoints -
        criticalCutAngle - definition of "sharp angle"
        Returns:
        new Polygon, Array list of SkelLineString

      • handleBadVertex

        public static SkelLineString handleBadVertex(Polygon p,
                                             Coordinate[] cs,
                                             java.util.ArrayList rings,
                                             int ringNumber,
                                             int pointNumber,
                                             double angle)

      • createCutLine

        public static Coordinate[] createCutLine(Polygon p,
                                         Coordinate[] cs,
                                         double ratio,
                                         double angle)
        1. find the cut edge (3 points) 2. intersect the line with all the lines -> shouldnt intersect any of the lines except the given ring 3. the intersection points should be either 0,1, or 2. if >2 then need to move c closer to the apex and try again if =0 then we're good if =1 or 2, then we must check to see if the intersection points are really-really close to the original points if so, we're good, otherwise move c closer to apex. 4. return null if the computed line is "bad" otherwise return the 3 new coordinates to replace the other
        Parameters:
        angle - --- angle of the river entry point where we're cutting (see code)

      • checkCutLine

        public static LineString checkCutLine(Coordinate[] cutline,
                                      MultiLineString intersection)
        verifies that a cutline intersecting with the polygon is okay a) if there's >2 peices, then there's a problem (actually, if there's >3 but this rarely occurs) b) if there's 1 its fine c) if there's 2, then its only fine if you can group it into two bins: 1. actual intersection 2. a little tiny part thats equal to cutline[0] or cutline[2]
        Parameters:
        cutline - 3 coodinats that make up the cut line
        intersection - cutline intesected with the polygon
        Returns:
        the main linestring or NULL if there's a problem.

      • findVector

        public static java.lang.Object[] findVector(java.util.ArrayList rings,
                                            Coordinate apex)
        returns 3 coordinates, in the correct order for angle determination and an Integer for the Ring# (0=exterior) and an Integer for the Point# (0=1st in ring)
        Parameters:
        rings -
        apex -
        Returns:

      • removeClosePoints

        public static Polygon removeClosePoints(Polygon p,
                                        Coordinate[] importantVertex,
                                        double criticalDistance)
        Finds importantVertexes on Polygon. If a vertex is very close (<0.1) to the important vertex, it is removed. This is very inefficient for a bunch of points near an importantVertex. ASSUMES: always a "good" vertex between 2 river entry points
        Parameters:
        p -
        importantVertex -
        criticalDistance - usually 0.1 or 1.0 is a good distance
        Returns:
